channel.title: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?
channel.description: Hey fellow Moparscapians, I need help setting up a VPS for my friends 667 Server he changed the IP in the Client to the VPS IP but it just doesn't work, any help?

item.title: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:9, topic:541213”][quote author=ultimatepkvillage link=topic=660085.msg4416915#msg4416915 date=1396326469]
Dude just stop you clearly don’t understand. And this person doesn’t even bother to reply :palm:
[/quote]
No, you’re the one that doesn’t understand. Read a book and you might stop coming across as a pleb.[/quote]stop making a fool of yourself lothy, everyone knows that dns bypasses the tertiary firewall for port 43594

Read full topic
item.source: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?

item.title: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:5, topic:541213”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=660085.msg4416090#msg4416090 date=1395985481]
You do not need No-IP what so ever. No-IP is basically a DNS service (Actually I think they call it that). The only reason you’d need no-ip is if the IP address your VPS is on is not static.
[/quote]

Stop with the point dexter shit I know what No-ip does. You are wrong there because No-ip leads to many reason why you’d need it. The majority of people I have helped on this forum with vps had no-ip. And we got it to work perfectly, did not face the problem this person is having. My information provided is correct sir as well as falconpunch don’t try to misinform the community.[/quote]
Dude. The only reason you would ever need a no-ip is if the vps you’re using doesn’t have a static ip address. Other than that, you don’t need it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?

item.title: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

sk8rdude461:

You do not need No-IP what so ever. No-IP is basically a DNS service (Actually I think they call it that). The only reason you’d need no-ip is if the IP address your VPS is on is not static.

Stop with the point dexter shit I know what No-ip does. You are wrong there because No-ip leads to many reason why you’d need it. The majority of people I have helped on this forum with vps had no-ip. And we got it to work perfectly, did not face the problem this person is having. My information provided is correct sir as well as falconpunch don’t try to misinform the community.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?

item.title: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ultimatepkvillage:

He needs to download no-ip again on the vps and use that ip in the client.

You do not need No-IP what so ever. No-IP is basically a DNS service (Actually I think they call it that). The only reason you’d need no-ip is if the IP address your VPS is on is not static.

@OP falconpunch is correct. Also, a good way to make sure the ports are open is to turn the server on, and then go to http://canyouseeme.org and testing port 43594 (on the vps, of course)

Read full topic
item.source: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?

item.title: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?
item.dc:creator: @falconpunch777 falconpunch777
item.description:
@falconpunch777 wrote:

He needs to open 43594 in his inbound and outbound ports on his firewall. By the way revision doesn’t have an effect on setting up a VPS :P.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you setup a VPS for a 667?
